intro: Varronia alba, commonly known as white varronia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, dry fruits that contain several seeds. Varronia alba is often found in shaded, humid environments such as forests and undergrowth.
